He stared at the article, heart racing. 

Disgust surged through him. 

He tossed it aside. 

“Rodya,” his mother said, “you’ll be a leading man in Russian thought.” 

“Madness,” he muttered. 

“Dounia almost believed it,” she continued. 

“Father sent poems and a novel. They were rejected.” 

“Why do you care?” he asked. 

“Your talent can take you anywhere.” 

“Is Dounia home?” 

“No, she leaves me alone. Dmitri visits. He respects you.” 

“Mother, I have more important matters.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov's mother expresses her belief in his potential for greatness despite her worries about his current struggles.
